content:
There are a few issues with your text that you may want to consider improving:

1. The first sentence has a grammatical error. Instead of saying "that is lost in his mind looking at the mountains," it should be "who is lost in his mind looking at the mountains."
2. In the second sentence, the phrase "even if he doesn't have a safety vest" could be revised to "even though he doesn't have a safety vest" to improve the sentence structure.
3. The transition from the man falling asleep to waking up 30 minutes later could be improved for clarity. It is not clear how he went from falling asleep to realizing he is lost. You could add more detail to this section to improve the flow of the story.
4. In the last sentence, it would be better to use "is" instead of "and" when describing the authorities picking him up. You could revise the sentence to say, "He finally calls the authorities, and they come to pick him up and bring him back home."

Overall, with these improvements, your text could become a more polished and engaging short story.
